items.content_html: Watched the Orioles win against Boston and when they cut to the crowd during the 7th innings stretch as they played Taps, you could see the emotion on many people’s faces. I’m grateful people still remember the sacrifices paid to ensure our freedom.

items.content_html: How does ChatGTP’s super-mega-advanced-4o version pronounce the “Orioles”? Usually the voices get it right the first time but then they revert randomly to pronouncing it as Or-eye-ols. I’m so happy we are thrashing the planet and burning through energy for this amazing tech.
items.content_text: How does ChatGTP's super-mega-advanced-4o version pronounce the "Orioles"? Usually the voices get it right the first time but then they revert randomly to pronouncing it as Or-eye-ols. I'm so happy we are thrashing the planet and burning through energy for this amazing tech.

items.content_html: I used Anthropic’s Claude today for the first time and it flat out invented quotes from Pope Benedict XVI. When I asked it for references, it apologized and said that was a summary of a statement he made but could not say where from. All of the links it referenced were old and none of them worked. Artificial, yes. Intelligence? 🤷🏽

items.content_html:
🔗 Star Trek: Strange New Worlds has been renewed for a fourth season - The Verge // Charles Pulliam-Moore // theverge.com

Season 3 of Paramount Plus’ Star Trek: Strange New Worlds_ _is still in production, but the streamer has already decided to renew the series. Unfortunately, the same can’t be said of _Star Trek: Lower Decks_, which is coming to an end.

Love both of these Trek shows. I agree Lower Decks is at a good stopping point.
items.content_text: 🔗 Star Trek: Strange New Worlds has been renewed for a fourth season - The Verge // Charles Pulliam-Moore // *theverge.com* > Season 3 of Paramount Plus’ _[Star Trek: Strange New Worlds_](https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/10/23151967/star-trek-strange-new-worlds-filler-tv-is-fantastic)_ _is still in production, but the streamer has already decided to renew the series. Unfortunately, the same can’t be said of _[Star Trek: Lower Decks_](https://www.theverge.com/21356280/star-trek-lower-decks-review-cbs-all-access), which is coming to an end. Love both of these Trek shows. I agree Lower Decks is at a good stopping point.

items.content_html:
🔗 Stranded fishermen rescued from tiny island thanks to ‘HELP’ sign // // usatoday.com

Previous castaways spelled SOS on beach on same island in 2020

Nearly four years ago, three other boaters in a 23-foot boat who departed from Polowat Atoll on July 30, 2020, also washed onto the same island after their boat ran out of gas.

The crew spelled out a giant “SOS” sign on the beach which was spotted by the crew of a US Air Force tanker operating out of Andersen Air Force Base on Guam.

Maybe they ought to put a radio on that island.
items.content_text: 🔗 Stranded fishermen rescued from tiny island thanks to 'HELP' sign // // *usatoday.com* > ## Previous castaways spelled SOS on beach on same island in 2020 > > Nearly four years ago, three other boaters in a 23-foot boat who departed from Polowat Atoll on July 30, 2020, also washed onto the same island after their boat ran out of gas. > > The crew spelled out a giant “SOS” sign on the beach which was spotted by the crew of a US Air Force tanker operating out of Andersen Air Force Base on Guam. Maybe they ought to put a radio on that island.

items.content_html: I cannot think of a single reason why I would need the Humane AI pin in a world where I have an Apple Watch or have AirPods in and also have a phone in my pocket. Assuming that Siri gets much better at stuff after the AI updates this year, as long as I have a way to control its functions without actually touching the phone, I don’t see why I would need to use the AI pin.
items.content_text: I cannot think of a single reason why I would need the Humane AI pin in a world where I have an Apple Watch or have AirPods in and also have a phone in my pocket. Assuming that Siri gets much better at stuff after the AI updates this year, as long as I have a way to control its functions without actually touching the phone, I don’t see why I would need to use the AI pin.

items.content_html:
🔗 New family plans and pricing on Fastmail — notes.ghed.in

New multi-user plans make Fastmail more affordable for your household. The new Duo plan gives secure, private email to you and a partner at a reduced price. For just a little more, our Family plan includes up to six people, so you can upgrade your whole family.

Looking forward to this! Fastmail has been very reliable for me.
items.content_text: 🔗 New family plans and pricing on Fastmail — *notes.ghed.in* > New multi-user plans make Fastmail more affordable for your household. The new **Duo** plan gives secure, private email to you and a partner at a reduced price. For just a little more, our **Family** plan includes up to six people, so you can upgrade your whole family. Looking forward to this! Fastmail has been very reliable for me.

items.content_html: Didn’t get a chance to post yesterday about this, but I did get a chance to enjoy the partial eclipse in my area. I got to my son’s high school a little before pickup and spent about five minuted before and after the peak. It was the first time I’ve done this and I wish I and been able to see totality.

items.content_html: Had a nice morning. After church we visited a spot downtown with a food market and a popup vintage clothing market, popped into a local plant shop, and a local book store. Oh, and empanadas and ice cream.
items.content_text:
Had a nice morning. After church we visited a spot downtown with a food market and a popup vintage clothing market, popped into a local plant shop, and a local book store. Oh, and empanadas and ice cream. 

![Variegated green and white pothos plant hangs from a black pot, indoor setting with soft natural light filtering through the leaves.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1638.jpg)

![A transparent pink dragonfly ornament is clipped onto a green stem, with a blurred indoor plant-filled background.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1639.jpg)

![Potted plants line a wooden shelf against a brick wall, with empty woven baskets above them.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1640.jpg)

![A metal scoop rests in a container of tropical soil, situated in a plant-filled shop with a sink and potted plants.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1641.jpg)

![A collection of black pebbles closely packed together, filling the frame with their shiny textures.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1642.jpg)

![Multiple colorful plastic dinosaur toys are scattered in a decorative metallic bowl on a wooden surface.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1643.jpg)

![A sticker on a worn surface depicts a knife and vegetables with the text "VEGGIE MASSACRE."](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1644.jpg)

![Bookshelves line a cozy, well-lit bookstore; various titles indicate a wide selection, and a person browses in the background.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1645.jpg)

![A black silhouette of a dog sits next to a sign saying "Look! It's a Book Store" with an arrow, all painted on a green brick wall.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/5d528031fa.jpg)

items.content_html: Today I learned of the passing of Vernon Vinge. I read A Fire Upon the Deep in high school and it was a major turning point in my love of science fiction. I’m going to re-read True Names in his honor.
items.content_text: Today I learned of the passing of Vernon Vinge. I read _A Fire Upon the Deep_ in high school and it was a major turning point in my love of science fiction. I’m going to re-read _True Names_ in his honor.

items.content_html:
🔗 X's AI chatbot Grok made up a fake trending headline about Iran attacking Israel | Mashable — mashable.com

Even more concerning, the fake headline was apparently generated by X’s own official AI chatbot, Grok, and then promoted by X’s trending news product, Explore, on the very first day of an updated version of the feature.

This is what happens when you think technology can solve all the world’s problems. Too much “AI” too soon.
items.content_text: 🔗 X's AI chatbot Grok made up a fake trending headline about Iran attacking Israel | Mashable — *mashable.com* > Even more concerning, the fake headline was apparently generated by X's own official AI chatbot, Grok, and then promoted by X's trending news product, Explore, on the very first day of an updated version of the feature. This is what happens when you think technology can solve all the world’s problems. Too much “AI” too soon.

items.content_html:
📷 #mbApr Day 05

After a week in NYC, putting my feet up and taking in a deep breath of no people, cars, or noise is the serenity I needed.
items.content_text:
📷 #mbApr Day 05

![Feet on an ottoman, facing a TV in a cozy living room setting with plants and furniture.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1633.jpeg)

After a week in NYC, putting my feet up and taking in a deep breath of no people, cars, or noise is the serenity I needed.

items.content_html:
🔗 Save the date, parlor games, and the art of the meal — pillarcatholic.com

Easter isn’t a “date.” It is living history, linked in and out of time to God’s plan of salvation for all mankind and His relationship with His people. We don’t mark the occasion like an anniversary, we live it fully and actively — or at least we should.

Why Easter is the goat season.
items.content_text: 🔗 Save the date, parlor games, and the art of the meal — *pillarcatholic.com* > Easter isn’t a “date.” It is living history, linked in and out of time to God’s plan of salvation for all mankind and His relationship with His people. We don’t _mark_ the occasion like an anniversary, we _live_ it fully and actively — or at least we should. Why Easter is the goat season.

items.content_html:
🔗 All people of faith should stand against China’s Uyghur genocide | America Magazine — americamagazine.org

There seems to be no end in sight regarding disagreements on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, abortion, same-sex marriage and the like. But Christians, Jews and Muslims, as well as Democrats, Republicans and independents, can all agree that the Uyghur genocide, in which the Chinese Uyghur population (who are predominantly Muslim) has endured imprisonment, forced labor, religious persecution and much else, is an affront to human dignity and religious freedom.
items.content_text: 🔗 All people of faith should stand against China’s Uyghur genocide | America Magazine — *americamagazine.org* > There seems to be no end in sight regarding disagreements on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, abortion, same-sex marriage and the like. But Christians, Jews and Muslims, as well as Democrats, Republicans and independents, can all agree that the Uyghur genocide, in which the Chinese Uyghur population (who are predominantly Muslim) has endured imprisonment, forced labor, religious persecution and much else, is an affront to human dignity and religious freedom.

NYC 2024 Day 4

We headed up towards Central Park, hitting St. Patrick’s Cathedral, the NY public library, Bryant Park, Apple Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, a few shopping outlets, and an amazing Italian dinner.
items.content_text:
NYC 2024 Day 4

We headed up towards Central Park, hitting St. Patrick’s Cathedral, the NY public library, Bryant Park, Apple Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, a few shopping outlets, and an amazing Italian dinner.  

![wooden escalator at Macys.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1616.jpeg)

![Ornate archway with decorative tiles, framing a view of a tree and sky, implying an outdoor architectural setting.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1600.jpeg)

![A musician sits playing an erhu under a decorative archway, with silhouetted figures and a statue visible in the illuminated park background.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1598.jpeg)

![Cherry blossoms in full bloom stand before a towering, ornate building under a blue sky partly filled with clouds.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-0298.jpeg)

![Ornate golden altar with intricate designs, surrounded by flowers, set against a backdrop of tall stained-glass windows in a cathedral interior.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/cbab915e2e.jpeg)

![A highly ornate ceiling features embossed golden flowers within octagonal, dark panels, surrounded by floral designs, in a room with white decorative cornices.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1560.jpeg)

![Bare tree branches intersperse, partially obscuring a modern skyscraper against a cloudy sky backdrop.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/0d508ac87d.jpg)

items.content_text:
A good first day in Manhattan. 


![A number "28" sign on a pole with rivets, by a blurry, moving subway train in a station.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/9510a14965.jpeg)

![An orange laundry cart with linen is in focus in a dimly lit service area, under neon signs with the letters "XXX."](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/e96956371c.jpeg)

![A dimly-lit alleyway with vibrant graffiti on walls leads to a yellow service truck, situated under atmospheric hanging umbrellas and metal walkways, evoking an urban, gritty ambiance.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/adcdda2c30.jpeg)

![Fire escapes on a brick building with budding branches in the foreground and skyscrapers in the background, depicting an urban spring scene.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/f642e092d0.jpg)

![Cherry blossoms in focus, blooming on branches against a blurred urban park background.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1342.jpeg)

![Monochrome pavement composed of alternating dark and light rectangular bricks arranged in a staggered pattern.](https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/img-1329.jpeg)

items.content_html: First day back in the office after working from home for four years. Was fun to discover the IT guys raided my working space. I had some nice convos and there are aspects I’ve missed but overall it’s overrated.
items.content_text:
First day back in the office after working from home for four years. Was fun to discover the IT guys raided my working space. I had some nice convos and there are aspects I’ve missed but overall it’s overrated.

items.content_html: Well, it was nice to know you Key Bridge. I know several people at my son’s school who are impacted by this in terms of their daily commute. Thankfully we are not reliant on this bridge. My thoughts and prayers go out to anyone affected by this.

<video src="https://cdn.uploads.micro.blog/27737/2024/screenshotsafari2024-03-26-at-08.21.24.mp4" controls="controls" preload="metadata"></video>

Well, it was nice to know you Key Bridge. I know several people at my son's school who are impacted by this in terms of their daily commute. Thankfully we are not reliant on this bridge. My thoughts and prayers go out to anyone affected by this.

items.content_html: Today was one of those busy days that are a complete blur. Dog is sick so had to deal with lots of cleanup. Eleven driving segments totaling 125 miles. Cleaning, practicing music, taking the dog out 8 times. Can’t wait to fall asleep.
items.content_text: Today was one of those busy days that are a complete blur. Dog is sick so had to deal with lots of cleanup. Eleven driving segments totaling 125 miles. Cleaning, practicing music, taking the dog out 8 times. Can’t wait to fall asleep.

items.content_html:
I’m looking to build a pattern for helping my church audio/video clients put together documentation on how to use their AV systems and run their ministries, and I think I’m settling on ~~Craft Docs. Their free plans are quite good and you get quite a lot of great features for a wiki-style but nice looking set of documents. ~~

UPDATE: I have moved our documentation to a self-hosted instance of BookStack since there were too many limitations on the number of users and attachment size on Craft.
items.content_text:
I’m looking to build a pattern for helping my church audio/video clients put together documentation on how to use their AV systems and run their ministries, and I think I’m settling on ~~[Craft Docs](https://craft.do "Craft Docs"). Their free plans are quite good and you get quite a lot of great features for a wiki-style but nice looking set of documents. ~~

UPDATE: I have moved our documentation to a self-hosted instance of [BookStack](https://bookstackapp.com) since there were too many limitations on the number of users and attachment size on Craft.
